===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ていきん}} {{m|ltc|提琴|tr=dej gim}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|提琴|tr=tíqín}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|て|いきん}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[te̞ːkĩɴ]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ていきん}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ていきん|musical instrument}} a kind of traditional Chinese [[stringed instrument]] played with a [[bow]]
#: Depending on time period and region, this term may refer to the two-stringed [[w:Tiqin|tiqin]] or [[w:Yehu|yehu]], or to a [[w:Sihu (instrument)|sihu]] with four strings. Generally larger and with a lower [[range]] than the [[erhu]].<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
# {{lb|ja|sort=ていきん|rare}} a [[violin]], a [[fiddle]]
